summary.title: eTorch Threat Model
summary.description: Threat model for the eTorch intelligent lighting system. The system consists of smart eTorch devices, client applications (web, mobile, and Windows), a local field gateway, and a cloud portal. Users and administrators control lighting devices locally and remotely via HTTP/HTTPS communication. The model identifies threats using the STRIDE methodology and proposes mitigations.

diagrams.title: New STReTorch â€“ High Level DFD (STRIDE)IDE diagram

threats.title: Spoofing of user identity
threats.description: An attacker may impersonate a legitimate user to gain unauthorized access to the eTorch system and control lighting devices.
threats.mitigation: Use strong authentication mechanisms such as multi-factor authentication, secure password policies, and protected session management.

threats.title: Repudiation of user actions
threats.description: A user may deny performing actions such as changing device settings due to missing or insufficient audit logs.
threats.mitigation: Enable secure audit logging with timestamps and tamper-resistant log storage.

threats.title: Administrator account spoofing
threats.description: An attacker may impersonate an administrator to gain full control over system configuration and devices.
threats.mitigation: Require multi-factor authentication and privileged access controls for administrator accounts.

threats.title: Repudiation of administrative actions
threats.description: An administrator may deny performing critical actions such as firmware updates or access changes.
threats.mitigation: Maintain detailed, immutable audit logs for all administrative actions.

threats.title: Information disclosure via weak credentials
threats.description: Weak or reused passwords may allow attackers to access user accounts and sensitive system data.
threats.mitigation: Enforce strong password policies and protect credentials using secure hashing.

threats.title: Spoofed mobile client
threats.description: A malicious application may impersonate the official mobile app to access system services.
threats.mitigation: Use application authentication and certificate-based validation.

threats.title: Tampering with mobile requests
threats.description: Requests sent from the mobile application may be modified by an attacker.
threats.mitigation: Use request signing and integrity checks.

threats.title: Information disclosure via insecure local storage
threats.description: Sensitive data stored insecurely on the mobile device may be accessed by attackers.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt sensitive data stored on the device.

threats.title: Replay attacks
threats.description: Previously captured requests may be replayed to repeat unauthorized actions.
threats.mitigation: Use nonces, timestamps, and message authentication.

threats.title: Credential brute-force attack
threats.description: An attacker may perform repeated login attempts to guess user credentials, potentially overwhelming the authentication service.
threats.mitigation: Implement rate limiting, account lockout mechanisms, and CAPTCHA protection.

threats.title: Privilege escalation through misconfiguration
threats.description: Improper role configuration may allow standard users to obtain administrator-level privileges.
threats.mitigation: Apply role-based access control and follow the principle of least privilege.

threats.title: Injection attacks on web inputs
threats.description: Malicious input may be injected into the web application to manipulate backend processing.
threats.mitigation: Validate and sanitize all user input on the server side.

threats.title: Session hijacking
threats.description: An attacker may steal or reuse session identifiers to impersonate a legitimate user.
threats.mitigation: Use secure cookies, HTTPS, and proper session expiration policies.

threats.title: Unauthorized API access
threats.description: Improper API authorization may allow unauthorized access to restricted functionality.
threats.mitigation: Enforce server-side authorization checks for all API endpoints.

threats.title: Information leakage via error messages
threats.description: Detailed error messages may reveal sensitive information about the system internals.
threats.mitigation: Use generic error messages and log detailed errors securely.

threats.title: Denial of service via excessive requests
threats.description: An attacker may overwhelm the web application with excessive requests, degrading availability.
threats.mitigation: Apply request throttling, rate limiting, and traffic monitoring.

threats.title: Cloud account spoofing
threats.description: An attacker may impersonate a cloud account to access system resources.
threats.mitigation: Apply strong authentication and identity verification mechanisms.

threats.title: Unauthorized cloud API access
threats.description: Misconfigured permissions may allow unauthorized access to cloud APIs.
threats.mitigation: Use least-privilege IAM policies and regular permission reviews.

threats.title: Tampering with cloud configuration
threats.description: Attackers may modify cloud configuration data to alter system behavior.
threats.mitigation: Protect configuration integrity using access controls and checksums.

threats.title: Data leakage from cloud storage
threats.description: Sensitive data stored in the cloud may be exposed due to misconfiguration.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt data at rest and restrict access using access control lists.

threats.title: Cloud service denial of service
threats.description: Cloud services may be overwhelmed by malicious traffic, affecting availability.
threats.mitigation: Use auto-scaling, rate limiting, and cloud-native DDoS protection.

threats.title: Privilege escalation via manipulated configuration
threats.description: Manipulated configuration data may be processed by the eTorch device in a way that grants elevated privileges or unauthorized control.
threats.mitigation: Validate configuration data before use and enforce strict privilege separation in device firmware.

threats.title: Unauthorized access to cloud storage
threats.description: Attackers may gain unauthorized access to sensitive configuration data or user information stored in the cloud.
threats.mitigation: Restrict access using strong access controls and encrypt sensitive data at rest.

threats.title: Loss or modification of audit data
threats.description: Audit logs stored in the cloud may be deleted or altered, preventing accountability for system actions.
threats.mitigation: Store logs in tamper-resistant storage with restricted write access.

threats.title: Tampering with local configuration database
threats.description: Stored configuration data in the local gateway database may be modified to alter system behavior.
threats.mitigation: Apply integrity checks and strict access controls to the database.

threats.title: Denial of service on local control communication
threats.description: An attacker may overload the local communication channel, disrupting control of eTorch devices.
threats.mitigation: Monitor local traffic and implement request throttling.

threats.title: Information disclosure during status update transmission
threats.description: Device status information may be exposed during transmission from the eTorch device to cloud storage.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt all transmitted data and verify secure communication channels.

threats.title: Command injection via device control flow
threats.description: Malicious or malformed commands may be injected into device control messages, causing unintended device behavior.
threats.mitigation: Validate and sanitize all device control commands before execution.

threats.title: Replay of device control commands
threats.description: Previously captured control commands may be replayed to trigger unauthorized actions
threats.mitigation: Use timestamps, sequence numbers, and message authentication codes to prevent replay attacks.

threats.title: Man-in-the-middle attack on HTTPS communication
threats.description: An attacker may intercept or eavesdrop on data transmitted between applications and the cloud portal if communication is not properly secured.
threats.mitigation: Enforce TLS encryption with proper certificate validation and secure cipher suites.

threats.title: Denial of service on HTTPS communication channel
threats.description: An attacker may flood the communication channel with excessive requests, preventing legitimate users from accessing the service.
threats.mitigation: Apply rate limiting, traffic filtering, and network-level monitoring.

threats.title: Man-in-the-middle attack on HTTPS communication
threats.description: An attacker may intercept or eavesdrop on data transmitted between applications and the cloud portal if communication is not properly secured.
threats.mitigation: Enforce TLS encryption with proper certificate validation and secure cipher suites.

threats.title: Denial of service on HTTPS communication channel
threats.description: An attacker may flood the communication channel with excessive requests, preventing legitimate users from accessing the service.
threats.mitigation: Apply rate limiting, traffic filtering, and network-level monitoring.

threats.title: Unauthorized firmware or configuration modification
threats.description: Attackers may modify device configuration or firmware to compromise device security.
threats.mitigation: Require digitally signed firmware and configuration updates.

threats.title: Information disclosure of device configuration
threats.description: Sensitive configuration data may be accessed by unauthorized users, revealing system settings or credentials.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt configuration data at rest and restrict access to authorized processes only.

threats.title: Repudiation of configuration changes
threats.description: An attacker or administrator may deny making configuration changes if actions are not properly logged.
threats.mitigation: Log all configuration changes with timestamps and protect logs from modification.

threats.title: Configuration corruption causing device malfunction
threats.description: Corrupted or invalid configuration data may prevent the eTorch device from operating correctly.
threats.mitigation: Validate configuration data before use and implement rollback or recovery mechanisms.
